title: Smallcaps height standards
content: so for "real" [smallcaps](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417193831/http:/typophile.com/wiki/small%20capitals), should they be the same height as the x-height? or can they be taller? is it just a matter of taste? or is there some rule that says they must be as tall (or short) as the x-height?
author: pablohoney77

comments.content:
I think it's important that smallcaps be visibly larger than the x-height, because otherwise they: look too small, since they have no extenders; and they can get confused, like think of "US". Most smallcaps seem too small to me.   
   
BTW, the same goes for old-style numerals.
